section.p: After you have successfully completed the installation of , you can optionally change the URL to be used for accessing the administration portal and the marketplaces. You can then start to set up the organizations using the administration portal.

section.title: Setting the Context Root
section.p: By default, i.e. if you used the installation scripts, the context root of the URL used for accessing the administration portal and the marketplaces is oscm-portal. You can change this setting in the application server administration console. In addition, you need to adapt the BASE_URL_HTTPS configuration setting, and, if specified, the BASE_URL configuration setting, in .

ol.li:
In the application server administration console:
Go to Applications -> oscm-portal -> Edit and set the Context Root as required.
Go to Applications -> oscm-portal-help -> Edit and set the Context Root analogously to the one for oscm-portal.
Example: If you set the context root for oscm-portal to MyPortal, set it to MyPortal-help for oscm-portal-help.

In the administration portal, go to Operation -> Update Configuration Settings and change the BASE_URL_HTTPS configuration setting, and, if specified, the BASE_URL configuration setting, accordingly. See below for details on accessing .

section.title: Accessing
section.p: You can access the administration portal in a Web browser using an URL in the following format:

<server> is the host of the application server where has been deployed. <port> is the port to address the application server (default: 8080 for HTTP, 8081 for HTTPS). <context-root> is the context root of (default: oscm-portal). <tenant-id> is the ID of the tenant specified when installing in SAML_SP mode. If installed in INTERNAL mode, the tenant ID is not appended to the URL.
You are prompted for a user ID and password.
Depending on the authentication mode, the initial credentials are the following:

ul.li:
INTERNAL:
User ID: administrator
Password: admin123
It is recommended that you change the initial password in the administration portal (Change Password page in the Account menu).

SAML_SP:
User ID: The ID you specified in the ADMIN_USER_ID configuration setting in the sso.properties configuration file.
Password: Password as known in the IdP for the above user.

section.title: Creating an Additional Operator Account
section.p: The creation of an additional operator account for your organization is useful, for example, to be able to delegate operational tasks or to unlock other operator accounts in case the password has been forgotten. Proceed as follows:
In the administration portal, choose Register new users in the Account menu. Enter the relevant user data and assign at least the Operator role.
